intro: Urophyllum floribundum var. annobonense, commonly known as the Annobonese uruphylum, is a flowering plant native to the island of Annobon in Equatorial Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsules as its fruiting structure. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
